channel.title: Bush TAKES BLAME IN IRAQ, adds troops
channel.description:
[b]WASHINGTON[/b] (CNN) -- President Bush on Wednesday night will announce a plan to send about 20,000 more troops to Iraq in an effort to pacify Baghdad, a U.S. official said.
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/01/10/iraq.bush/ ...edit by Ron, had to change title. It's much more clear. Here is a different opinion from yahoo. CNN tends to be more biased. Try this article as well. http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070111/ap_on_go_pr_wh/us_iraq

item.title: Bush TAKES BLAME IN IRAQ, adds troops
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:13, topic:46189”][quote author=Gotta Catch Them All link=topic=64270.msg763604#msg763604 date=1168640429]

well sending them over is good its there fault for joining the army

Hmph, my dad joined the Air Force when he was 15 because of his faggot parents. Some people don’t have a choice - he wanted to get away from his parents, and that was the only realistic was for him to do so.

he could have rented a shitty apartment, or lived with one of his mates.
[/quote]
How do you figure that? Renting would cost a few hundred dollars every month? I don’t know about American wages, but over here that’s highly unrealistic for 15 year olds.
Oh, and by saying unrealistic, I mean that he wouldn’t have the cash for everything else like food etc if he was spending that cash on an apartment.[/quote]

Your right. scrap the idea about the apartment, overall my point was that it was his choice for signing up.

Read full topic
item.source: Bush TAKES BLAME IN IRAQ, adds troops

Hmph, my dad joined the Air Force when he was 15 because of his faggot parents. Some people don’t have a choice - he wanted to get away from his parents, and that was the only realistic was for him to do so.
[/quote]

he could have rented a shitty apartment, or lived with one of his mates.[/quote]
How do you figure that? Renting would cost a few hundred dollars every month? I don’t know about American wages, but over here that’s highly unrealistic for 15 year olds.
Oh, and by saying unrealistic, I mean that he wouldn’t have the cash for everything else like food etc if he was spending that cash on an apartment.

well sending them over is good its there fault for joining the army

lol good point, but also, a lot of people join the army cause they have no money to go to college. And that’s sad. sigh if only… (wishful thinking)

Edit: I didn’t realize I posted the same article like 2 min after this one. I removed it and changed the title of this topic to make it more clear. Hope you don’t mind white castle. lol this was my original title.

BUSH ADMITS HE FUCKED UP IN IRAQ!!!
